<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Stumbling Stance](/Feats.aspx?ID=1735) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=112" />
<trait label="Stance" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=152" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 128 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Martial Artist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=67) (Level 4)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5)

</column>

---

You enter a seemingly unfocused stance that mimics the movements of the inebriated—bobbing, weaving, leaving false openings, and distracting your enemies from your true movements. While in this stance, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) checks to [Feint](/Actions.aspx?ID=48). The only Strikes you can make are stumbling swing unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 bludgeoning damage; are in the [brawling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=4) group; and have the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [backstabber](/Traits.aspx?ID=172), [finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), and [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) traits. If an enemy hits you with a melee Strike while in this stance, it becomes flat-footed against the next stumbling swing Strike you make against it before the end of your next turn.

<title level="2">Stumbling Stance leads to...</title>
[Stumbling Feint](/Feats.aspx?ID=1744)
name: Stumbling Stance
